intro: Xanthomyrtus flavida subsp. taxifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved myrtle, is a shrub native to eastern Australia. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, white hairs. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or heathland environments. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
